If you think 3% MS doesn't make a difference then it sounds like you're the one without game knowledge. If you really think movement speed is such an irrelevant stat then we can look at Plat+ stats for AP junglers before and after Runic's nerf:

Diana pre-nerf: 51.63% win rate, 3.39% pick rate
Diana post-nerf: 49.56% win rate, 3.30% pick rate

Ekko pre-nerf: 51.53% win rate, 4.47% pick rate
Ekko post-nerf: 50.97% win rate, 4.90% pick rate

Elise pre-nerf: 50.42% win rate, 12.39% pick rate
Elise post-nerf: 48.58% win rate, 9.74% pick rate

Evelynn pre-nerf: 50.21% win rate, 3.46% pick rate
Evelynn post-nerf: 48.86% win rate, 3.44% pick rate

Fiddlesticks pre-nerf: 51.83% win rate, 2.06% pick rate
Fiddlesticks post-nerf: 50.24% win rate, 1.74% pick rate

Fizz pre-nerf: 49.42% win rate, 1.84% pick rate
Fizz post-nerf: 49.33% win rate, 1.89% pick rate

Gragas pre-nerf: 50.24% win rate, 6.22% pick rate
Gragas post-nerf: 49.89% win rate, 13.37% pick rate
(pick rate spike is obviously the delayed kicking in of "Gragas is strong again", win rate last patch was arguably skewed by people still picking Cinderhulk)

Nidalee pre-nerf: 50.12% win rate, 8.93% pick rate
Nidalee post-nerf: 50.41% win rate, 9.30% pick rate
(no idea)

Udyr pre-nerf: 57.48% win rate, 12.88% pick rate
Udyr post-nerf: 55.31% win rate, 8.47% pick rate
(obviously he got his own nerfs too so the impact of Runic's nerf is skewed)

_________________________

Literally every AP jungler's win rate dropped this patch except Nidalee's, some even dropping by 1-1.5% or so and with pick rates falling almost across the board. That's not a placebo nerf - movement speed matters.

By the way, you don't need to be Gold+ to know how to use the word "literally". And Gold+ people really shouldn't be assuming that something that was broken in the past is still broken now.

Xin, Udyr, Yi, etc are actually ineffective with no mana. Neither would reach a target to auto attack them to death with their on-hit nonsense. If you're letting an oom Xin or Udyr walk all over your team, then it's an issue with your team and not the champion. Devour and Runic aren't the only jungle enchantments either, all mana based tanks who use Cinder are worthless with no mana, and any mana gated champion that use warrior is also worthless with no mana.

Elise should also be the least of your worries, she had been good with every ap enchantment while also doing extremely well with Cinderhulk. Comparing her to champions that can only be good with 1 of the available and are rarely at the top is silly. Ranged champions are meant to be slower than melee champions anyways, they have range to compensate for being slower and most of them have cc in addition to range and sometimes even mobility. They are meant to be punished when jumped on. You're also only picking out the ones that favor your argument anyways, Naut was in the jungle for a while and he's at 325 move speed while there's also Malphite and Shen with 335. I don't even know why you brought up move speed honestly, some of the champions abusing this item are at the higher end of the base move speed, they also have mobility built into their kits, and also have cc. Elise isn't the only champion buying this item, and it's not only ranged champions buying it either. Unless of course you think Grag, Rumble, Udyr, and Amu are extremely slow ranged champions.

You have both Devour and Cinderhulk junglers choosing to buy Runic Echoes instead, and they win more often with Runic Echoes than they do with their original item. You know, similar to how everyone before was buying Cinderhulk until it was nerfed.
